attributes.action: Give no pay rise to mps
attributes.additional_details: Most mps sit on extra committees have ministerial pay and outside interests which give them extra money they also get expenses and mortgage help on second homes, Any money paid to an mp  for a second mortgage should be repayable to the public purse. As if a nurse or police officer got accommodation their wages would show a deduction to take it into account.
attributes.background: With the uk finances in a bad way cuts to aid and nurses suffering with cost of living out stripping their wages, I don't think mps deserve a pay rise,

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The Independent Parliamentary Standards Authority (IPSA) is responsible for deciding on MPs' expenses and pay. IPSA is independent of both Parliament and Government.

You can find out how to contact IPSA here: http://www.theipsa.org.uk/about-us/contact-us/
